intro: Crepis blinii, commonly known as the Siberian mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of Eastern Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Its leaves are hairy and form a rosette, while its stems are usually short and creeping. Crepis blinii is known for its resilience to harsh climates and is often used in ecological restoration projects.
